feed.title: Zitnik Lab
feed.subtitle: Harvard Machine Learning for Medicine and Science

entry.title: PINNACLE in Nature Methods
entry.content: PINNACLE contextual AI model is published in Nature Methods. Paper. Research Briefing. Project website.
entry.summary: PINNACLE contextual AI model is published in Nature Methods. Paper. Research Briefing. Project website.

entry.title: Digital Twins as Global Health and Disease Models of Individuals

link.title: Digital Twins as Global Health and Disease Models of Individuals

entry.content: Paper on digitial twins outlining strategies to leverage molecular and computational techniques to construct dynamic digital twins on the scale of populations to individuals.
entry.summary: Paper on digitial twins outlining strategies to leverage molecular and computational techniques to construct dynamic digital twins on the scale of populations to individuals.

entry.title: Graph Diffusion Convolutions at ICML
entry.content: Graph diffusion convolution is a geometric deep learning architecture that aggregates information from higher-order network neighbors through a generalized graph diffusion to enhance model robustness to noisy and incomplete datasets. Paper at ICML.
entry.summary: Graph diffusion convolution is a geometric deep learning architecture that aggregates information from higher-order network neighbors through a generalized graph diffusion to enhance model robustness to noisy and incomplete datasets. Paper at ICML.

entry.title: Three Papers: TrialBench, 3D Structure Design, LLM Editing

link.title: Three Papers: TrialBench, 3D Structure Design, LLM Editing

entry.content: New papers on TrialBench with AI-ready clinical trial datasets, structure-based drug design benchmark, and composable interventions for language models.
entry.summary: New papers on TrialBench with AI-ready clinical trial datasets, structure-based drug design benchmark, and composable interventions for language models.

entry.title: TDC-2: Multimodal Foundation for Therapeutics
entry.content: The Commons 2.0 (TDC-2) is an overhaul of Therapeutic Data Commons to catalyze research in multimodal models for drug discovery by unifying single-cell biology of diseases, biochemistry of molecules, and effects of drugs through multimodal datasets, AI-powered API endpoints, new tasks and benchmarks. Our paper.
entry.summary: The Commons 2.0 (TDC-2) is an overhaul of Therapeutic Data Commons to catalyze research in multimodal models for drug discovery by unifying single-cell biology of diseases, biochemistry of molecules, and effects of drugs through multimodal datasets, AI-powered API endpoints, new tasks and benchmarks. Our paper.

entry.title: Broad MIA: Protein Language Models
entry.content: Check out our Broad’s seminars on Multimodal protein language models for deciphering protein function.
entry.summary: Check out our Broad’s seminars on Multimodal protein language models for deciphering protein function.

entry.title: On Knowing a Gene in Cell Systems

link.title: On Knowing a Gene in Cell Systems

entry.content: We shed light on distributional gene representations and their potential applications in biology to characterize gene function from a broader and more holistic perspective.
entry.summary: We shed light on distributional gene representations and their potential applications in biology to characterize gene function from a broader and more holistic perspective.

entry.title: Biomedical AI Agents
entry.content: We envision ‘AI scientists’ as systems capable of skeptical learning and reasoning that empower biomedical research through collaborative agents that integrate machine learning tools with experimental platforms.
entry.summary: We envision ‘AI scientists’ as systems capable of skeptical learning and reasoning that empower biomedical research through collaborative agents that integrate machine learning tools with experimental platforms.

entry.title: Efficient ML Seminar Series
entry.content: We started a Harvard University Efficient ML Seminar Series. Congrats to Jonathan for spearheading this initiative. Harvard Magazine covered the first meeting focusing on LLMs.
entry.summary: We started a Harvard University Efficient ML Seminar Series. Congrats to Jonathan for spearheading this initiative. Harvard Magazine covered the first meeting focusing on LLMs.

entry.title: UniTS - Unified Time Series Model
entry.content: UniTS is a unified time series model that can process classification, forecasting, anomaly detection and imputation tasks within a single model with no task-specific modules. UniTS has zero-shot, few-shot, and prompt learning capabilities. Project website.
entry.summary: UniTS is a unified time series model that can process classification, forecasting, anomaly detection and imputation tasks within a single model with no task-specific modules. UniTS has zero-shot, few-shot, and prompt learning capabilities. Project website.
